Content Encryption & Protection

Protect sensitive content withÂ client-side password encryption. Perfect forÂ private notes, premium content, orÂ restrictedÂ information.

Overview

TheÂ encryption plugin allows youÂ to:

  • Encrypt pageÂ content â€“ Protect sensitiveÂ information
  • Password protectÂ pages â€“ Require password toÂ view
  • Client-sideÂ decryption â€“ NoÂ serverÂ needed
  • TransparentÂ integration â€“ Works withÂ markdown andÂ templates
  • Minimal performanceÂ impact â€“ Encryption/decryption isÂ fast
  • NoÂ dependencies â€“ Pure JavaScript, noÂ librariesÂ required

Use Cases

  • ğŸ“ PrivateÂ notes â€“ Keep personal thoughtsÂ encrypted
  • ğŸ’¼ PremiumÂ content â€“ Protect exclusive articles behindÂ passwords
  • ğŸ” SensitiveÂ information â€“ Encrypt confidentialÂ data
  • ğŸ‘¥ Member-onlyÂ areas â€“ Restrict access toÂ specificÂ users
  • ğŸ“Š ProprietaryÂ data â€“ Protect businessÂ information
  • ğŸ“ CourseÂ materials â€“ Lock content untilÂ payment/enrollment

HowÂ ItÂ Works

Encryption Process

  1. You writeÂ content normally inÂ markdown orÂ templates
  2. Set encrypted:Â true inÂ frontÂ matter
  3. Plugin encrypts theÂ content atÂ buildÂ time
  4. HTML includes encryptedÂ payload + decryptionÂ UI
  5. Users enterÂ password inÂ browser
  6. Content decryptsÂ client-side â€“ never sent toÂ server

Security Model

  • Algorithm: SHA256-based XORÂ encryption
  • Location: Encryption/decryption happens entirely inÂ browser
  • Password: User enters atÂ view time, notÂ stored
  • Transport: NoÂ encryption keys transmitted toÂ server
  • Storage: Encrypted content embedded inÂ HTML

[!WARNING] ThisÂ provides contentÂ obfuscation, not military-grade security. ItÂ prevents casual viewing butÂ determined attackers couldÂ potentially decrypt. ForÂ highly sensitive data, use server-side accessÂ control.

Basic Setup

Enable Encryption

Add toÂ eleventy.config.js:

import Standard from â€œ@zefish/standardâ€;

export default function (eleventyConfig) {
  eleventyConfig.addPlugin(Standard, {
    encryption: {
      enabled: true,
      // Additional optionsÂ below
    }
  });

  return {
    dir: { input: â€œcontentâ€, output: â€œ_siteâ€ }
  };
}

Protect aÂ Page

Create aÂ markdown file withÂ encryptionÂ enabled:


title: Private Notes
encrypted: true
password: mypassword123


# PrivateÂ Notes

This content is password-protected and encrypted.

Only visible to someone with the password.

Thatâ€™sÂ it! TheÂ pluginÂ automatically:

  1. Encrypts theÂ content
  2. Creates aÂ passwordÂ prompt
  3. Handles decryption onÂ theÂ client

Time-Limited Content

Configuration

Advanced configuration options inÂ eleventy.config.js:

eleventyConfig.addPlugin(Standard, {
  encryption: {
    // Enable/disableÂ encryption
    enabled: true,

    // UIÂ customization
    ui: {
      // Placeholder text forÂ passwordÂ input
      placeholder: â€œEnterÂ passwordâ€¦â€,

      // ButtonÂ text
      buttonText: â€œUnlockâ€,

      // ErrorÂ message
      errorMessage: â€œInvalid password. TryÂ again.â€,

      // Success message (shownÂ briefly)
      successMessage: â€œContentÂ unlocked!â€,

      // HeadingÂ text
      heading: â€œProtectedÂ Contentâ€,

      // InstructionÂ text
      instruction: â€œThisÂ content isÂ password-protected.â€,
    },

    // EncryptionÂ settings
    encryption: {
      // Hashing iterations (higher = slower butÂ moreÂ secure)
      iterations: 10,000,

      // Salt length inÂ bytes
      saltLength: 16,
    },

    //Â Styling
    style: {
      // Custom CSS class forÂ encryptedÂ section
      containerClass: â€œencrypted-contentâ€,

      // Theme: â€˜lightâ€™, â€˜darkâ€™, orÂ â€˜autoâ€™
      theme: â€œautoâ€,

      // Custom backgroundÂ color
      backgroundColor: â€œtransparentâ€,
    },

    //Â Layout
    layout: â€œdefaultâ€, // orÂ â€œminimalâ€
  }
});

Options Explained

| Option | Type | Default | Description | |â€”||â€”|-| | enabled | boolean | true | Enable encryption feature | | ui.placeholder | string | â€œEnterÂ passwordâ€¦â€ | Input placeholder | | ui.buttonText | string | â€œUnlockâ€ | Button label | | ui.errorMessage | string | Error text | Message onÂ wrong password | | ui.successMessage | string | Success text | Shown after unlock | | encryption.iterations | number | 10,000 | Hash iterations | | style.theme | string | â€œautoâ€ | Light/dark/auto theme | | layout | string | â€œdefaultâ€ | UI layout styleÂ |

Front Matter Options

Control encryptionÂ per-page:


title: Protected Article

# EncryptionÂ settings

  heading: "VIP Content"

  buttonText: "Reveal"
  placeholder: "VIP password"

Styling Encrypted Content

Default Styles

TheÂ plugin includes default styling forÂ theÂ passwordÂ prompt:

/* Encrypted content containerÂ */
.encrypted-content {
  border: 2px solid var(--color-accent);
  padding: 2rem;
  border-radius: 8px;
  text-align: center;
  background: var(--color-background);
}

/* Password promptÂ */
.encrypted-prompt {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  gap: 1rem;
  max-width: 300px;
  margin: 0 auto;
}

/* Input fieldÂ */
.encrypted-promptÂ input {
  padding: 0.75rem;
  border: 1px solid var(--color-accent);
  border-radius: 4px;
  font-size: 1rem;
}

/* Unlock buttonÂ */
.encrypted-promptÂ button {
  padding: 0.75rem 1.5rem;
  background: var(--color-accent);
  color: white;
  border: none;
  border-radius: 4px;
  cursor: pointer;
  font-weight: bold;
}

.encrypted-promptÂ button:hover {
  opacity: 0.9;
}

Custom Styling

Override withÂ your ownÂ CSS:

/* Custom encrypted containerÂ */
.my-encrypted {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
  color: white;
  padding: 3rem;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 8px 32px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);
}

.my-encryptedÂ input {
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
  border: 1px solid white;
  color: white;
  padding: 1rem;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

.my-encryptedÂ input::placeholder {
  color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7);
}

.my-encryptedÂ button {
  background: white;
  color: #667eea;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 1rem 2rem;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

InÂ frontÂ matter:


title: Styled Protected Content

  containerClass: my-encrypted

Password Security Best Practices

Strong Passwords


# Good passwords (reasonablyÂ unique)
password: Phoenix2024Rising

# Weak passwords (easy toÂ guess)
password: 123456     # Too simple
password: password   # Too common
password: a          # Too short

Password Management

ForÂ sharing:

  1. Share password through separate secureÂ channel

    • Not inÂ email withÂ link
    • Not inÂ sameÂ document
    • Not inÂ URLÂ parameters

  2. Use forÂ semi-publicÂ content (not highlyÂ sensitive)

    • PremiumÂ articles
    • MemberÂ previews
    • Time-limitedÂ access

  3. Rotate passwordsÂ regularly

    • Change after specificÂ date
    • Expire old accessÂ codes
    • Create new passwords forÂ newÂ courses

Example: Rotating Passwords


title: Conference Materials
encrypted: true
password: conf-oct-2024  # Change November 1st
expires: "2024-10-31"
note: "Password changes after conference"

Decryption onÂ Client

HowÂ ItÂ Works

  1. Browser receives encryptedÂ HTML withÂ password-protectedÂ content
  2. User entersÂ password inÂ form
  3. JavaScript hashes theÂ password
  4. XOR decryptionÂ applied withÂ hashedÂ password
  5. Content revealed ifÂ passwordÂ correct
  6. Nothing sent toÂ server

Performance

  • Encryption: ~10ms forÂ typicalÂ page
  • Decryption: ~10ms forÂ typicalÂ page
  • Impact: Negligible build timeÂ increase
  • Size: ~2KB additionalÂ JavaScript

Privacy

  • NoÂ serverÂ logs â€“ Password never sent toÂ server
  • NoÂ tracking â€“ Decryption happens entirelyÂ client-side
  • NoÂ cookies â€“ Password not stored inÂ browser
  • Temporary â€“ Password onlyÂ inÂ memory while sessionÂ active

Troubleshooting

Password Not Working

Problem: Password prompt appears butÂ password doesnâ€™tÂ unlock

Solutions:

  1. Verify password matches exactlyÂ (case-sensitive)
  2. Check noÂ typos inÂ password inÂ frontÂ matter
  3. Clear browser cache andÂ reload
  4. Rebuild site: npxÂ @11ty/eleventy

Content Not Visible After Unlock

Problem: Page still shows encrypted section after enteringÂ password

Solutions:

  1. Check browser console forÂ errorsÂ (F12)
  2. Verify JavaScript enabled inÂ browser
  3. Ensure encryption isÂ enabled inÂ config
  4. Try differentÂ browser

Build Includes Unencrypted Content

Problem: Encrypted content showing plain text inÂ HTMLÂ file

Solutions:

  1. Verify encrypted:Â true inÂ frontÂ matter
  2. Check encryption.enabled:Â true inÂ config
  3. Run full rebuild (notÂ incremental)
  4. Clear _site folder andÂ rebuild

Performance Issues

Problem: Build isÂ slow withÂ many encryptedÂ pages

Solutions:

  1. Encryption overhead isÂ minimal (~10ms perÂ page)
  2. Check ifÂ unrelated plugins areÂ slow
  3. Profile: npx @11ty/eleventyÂ â€“profile
